info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 3:28AM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EASTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM to 6 PM CST Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Beaver. In Texas...Hansford and Ochiltree. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 to 12 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Values between 3 and 6 are expected across a majority of the Panhandles, with values of 7 possible in the Oklahoma and northern Texas Panhandles. * Timing...Wednesday morning through the late afternoon hours.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
